src:
BMKG Laporkan Terjadi Gempa M 4,3 di Tanggamus Lampung
07 Nov 2019, 01:08 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Ilustrasi gempa. (Istockphoto/ Doguhakan)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Badan Meteorologi, Klimatologi, dan Geofisika (BMKG) melaporkan telah terjadiÂ gempa dengan magnitudo 4,3 terjadi di Tanggamus, Lampung pada Rabu (6/11) malam.BMKG melalui akun Twitter menjelaskan gempa itu terjadi pada pukul 23.05 WIB. Titik pusat gempa berada di 6,07 Lintang Selatan, 104,29 Bujur Timur. "Pusat gempa berada di Laut 78 km Barat Daya Tanggamus," tulis BMKG yang juga menyatakan gempa terjadi pada kedalaman 19 km.



Gempa ini dirasakan dengan skala intensitas I-II MMI (Modified Mercalli Intensity) di Liwa, Lampung Barat. Dalam skala itu getaran yang terasa karena gempa lemah dan tidak memiliki potensi bahaya.Gempa di Tanggamus ini merupakan yang kedua dalam beberapa hari. Sebelumnya pada Minggu (3/11) BMKG juga melaporkan terjadi gempa dengan magnitudo 3,4 terjadi pukul 18.38 WIB di Tanggamus.Pusat gempa dengan skala intensitas I-II MMI itu berada di darat, 23 km Baratlaut Tanggamus di kedalaman 1 km.




(fea)
text:
BMKG Reports A 4.3 M Earthquake Occurred at Tanggamus Lampung
Nov 7 2019, 01:08 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Illustration of an earthquake. (Istockphoto / Doguhakan)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The Meteorology, Climatology and Geophysics Agency (BMKG) reports that an earthquake with a magnitude of 4.3 occurred at Tanggamus, Lampung on Wednesday (6/11) night. BMKG via Twitter account explained the earthquake occurred at 23.05 WIB The epicenter of the earthquake is at 6.07 South Latitude, 104.29 East Longitude. "The epicenter was in the Sea 78 km southwest of Tanggamus," wrote the BMKG, which also stated that the earthquake occurred at a depth of 19 km.



This earthquake was felt with an intensity scale I-II MMI (Modified Mercalli Intensity) in Liwa, West Lampung. On that scale the vibrations felt by the earthquake were weak and did not have the potential for danger. The earthquake in Tanggamus was the second in a few days. Earlier on Sunday (3/11) BMKG also reported an earthquake with a magnitude of 3.4 occurred at 18.38 West Indonesia Time at the Tanggamus. The epicenter of the MMI intensity scale I-II was on land, 23 km northwest of Tanggamus at a depth of 1 km.




(fea)
